body: I agree to filter the `NaN` value. We didn't take into account that the double values might be `NaN`.
Why you have so many commits?
We require you to explain what is the issue, and how do you fix.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16773043/126306611-1574b7ad-0f76-4764-8d9c-b4e7a16bc289.png)
I got the metrics like this by using `otel-collector 0.30.0`,  the `NaN` value from otel-collector, and it seems a duplicate and wrong metric. If we don't know why they send this, I agree to filter the NaN value for defensive.

> Why this merge doesn't show the change in the commit log?
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/126291188-28b2e025-ba6f-4613-9333-d64f2d881550.png)
> 
> Please pay attention next time, this makes readers feeling we merge some dirty commits.

May caused by my browser networks, it delayed when I `squash and merge` PR, so, I chose to merge commit directly by mistake. I will pay attention next time.

> I am submitting a pull request to revert this. If you have a reasonable purpose, we could continue the discussion there.

Agree,

> Which plugin did you use, `prometheus-fetcher-plugin` or `otel-receiver-plugin`?
> AFAIK the `otel-collector` latest version has the `NaN` issue, the version below 0.29.0 words well.

Latest version too.

According to prometheus/client_golang#85, the NaN is reasonable

> > Which plugin did you use, `prometheus-fetcher-plugin` or `otel-receiver-plugin`?
> > AFAIK the `otel-collector` latest version has the `NaN` issue, the version below 0.29.0 words well.
> 
> Latest version too.
> 
> According to [prometheus/client_golang#85](https://github.com/prometheus/client_golang/issues/85), the NaN is reasonable

I agree NaN is meaningful than 0 or any other way. But I think we should take care of it one way or another.
I think we also should add a NaNSampleFamily as a subclass of `SampleFamily`, what do you think? @hanahmily @Lighfer @wankai123
is this feature still need to be contributed? I think it can be implemented by adding intercept points in `spring-amqp` interfaces since `spring-rabbit` is an implementation for that.

> is this feature still need to be contributed? I think it can be implemented by adding intercept points in `spring-amqp` interfaces since `spring-rabbit` is an implementation for that.

Contribution is welcome, you could read the plugin dev doc, the last part is about what are required to contribute a plugin or enhance a plugin.

> I think we also should add a NaNSampleFamily as a subclass of `SampleFamily`, what do you think? @hanahmily @Lighfer @wankai123

I think NaN value should just be handled in more details, aggregation operators or other methods in `SampleFamily` should take care of it, but I didn't understand the meaning of adding a NaNSampleFamily class, I think NaN value is meaningful when dealing with those samples where it comes from ,but meaningless when just put all NaN value  together？

My point is about, we need to put it works in all operations. But NaN is not a number or double, we need to be very careful about how to process it.
We could add a pull request to fliter it first. But more importantly, we should adopt this, rather than filtering it.
That is a test project, I don't know why you deploy that.

> 我解决了这个问题，因为Consul需要与客户端做健康检查，所以必须要告诉Consul本机地址与Ip，请看配置：
> 
> ```
>   consul:
>     serviceName: ${SW_SERVICE_NAME:"SkyWalking_OAP_Cluster"}
>     hostPort: ${SW_CLUSTER_CONSUL_HOST_PORT:10.0.0.1:8500,10.0.0.2:8500,10.0.0.3:8500}
>     internalComHost: 172.xxx.xxx #告诉Consul本节点Ip
>     internalComPort: 11800  #告诉Consul这个是健康检查的端口
> ```

可以解决这个问题，但是有些不配置也可以，搞不懂！
Because agent logger init process could fail, then logger could have different implementation. You should know, the community does not take the responsibility to explain codes.

As said in #2719, the existing rabbitmq plugin divides a total trace into two parts because of the internals of rabbitmq. I need a new one which can make a trace complete.
This plugin can fix it but **only** in spring. I haven't found a way to disable the existing one automatically when this plugin is active.😅 So I put it in optional plugins, to not make duplicate spans but give users an option to replace the existing plugin manually.

You haven't gotten my point. If spans could be duplicate, then both plugins work, then the only possibility a trace breaks, because the context doesn't propagate(across threads mostly), you just need a snapshot to propagate a context. Right now, you are creating another span, which makes you facing the duplicate span issue. We have plugins for Spring scope and out of Spring scope, they should not influence each other.

The plugin system is complex, we should never make users to determine how to choose in or out Spring use case, they will be confused about the difference.
